intro: Oenanthe meifolia, commonly known as the meadow dropwort, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant typically grows in moist meadows and stream banks, preferring temperate climates. Its flowers are small and white or greenish, arranged in umbrella-like clusters called umbels. Oenanthe meifolia is characterized by its slender stems and pinnately divided leaves, which contribute to its ornamental value in gardens.
